thread.title: Can You Set A Formal Dinner Table Like Martha Stewart
thread.title_full: Can You Set A Formal Dinner Table Like Martha Stewart

author: Sarah Aspler
title: Can You Set A Formal Dinner Table Like Martha Stewart
text:
View this image ›
BuzzFeed / PBS And here’s a little clue: It’s set for European dining, where salad follows the main course.
ID: 10491081 2. Hungry for a challenge? Let’s go! ID: 10491085 BuzzFeed It’s 1! The water class sits just above the main plate, to the right.
BuzzFeed It’s F! The soup spoon goes on the far right.
BuzzFeed It’s 2! The red wine glass sits above the water glass and the white wine glass.
BuzzFeed It’s G! The butter knife lays horizontal on the bread-and-butter plate.
BuzzFeed It’s C! The salad fork goes closest to the plate.
BuzzFeed It’s H! The dessert spoon sits just above the dessert fork.
BuzzFeed / Getty Via Getty Cheese Via Getty Cake Via Getty Pastry Via Getty Fish It’s for fish! Can You Set A Formal Dinner Table Like Martha Stewart? Yikes! You flunked this quiz. But that’s OK! It’s no big deal. We won’t tell Martha. Who needs more than one fork anyway?!
NBC You did just OK! You’ve got a solid grasp on the basics but you might have mixed up some of the spoons. It happens to the best of us! You still did a pretty impressive job! Go reward yourself with a quiche or roast chicken. You deserve it.
VH1 You’re a table-setting-superstar! You’ve got a strong intuition when it comes to etiquette and that’s pretty dang impressive. You can wine and dine with the best of them! Remember: It’s a good thing.
Omnimedia SHARE YOUR RESULTS ID: 10490554 4. Here’s what the entire table setting should look like, according to Martha Stewart . Hide
